name: Stichting Advisory Council for pelagic stocks
goal: The Pelagic AC prepares and provides advice on the management of pelagic fish stocks on behalf of the fisheries sector and other stakeholders. It covers the pelagic stocks of all the areas, excluding the stocks in the Baltic Sea and Mediterranean Sea. The Pelagic AC (as a foundation under Dutch law) was inaugurated on 16 August 2005, and consists of a General Assembly, an Executive Committee and two Working Groups. The work is furthermore done in collaboration with observers, for example, from non-EU countries that have an interest in particular stocks or regions covered by the Pelagic AC.
interests: Climate Action, Food Safety, Maritime affairs and fisheries, Regional Policy, Research and innovation
euInitiatives:
Common Fisheries Policy
Marine Strategy Framework Directive
Habitats Directive
Birds Directive
Northeast Atlantic Fisheries Commission
Maximum Sustainable Yield
Ecosystem Approach to Fisheries Management
Technical Measures Regulation
Fisheries Control Regulation
